datafield.subfield: HD Woodson and Metropolitan AME Church Collection
The collection consists of annual programs, the constitution and by-laws of the club, the history of the club, and correspondence.
The materials in this collection were found by the resident of 18 Quincy Place, NE. This was the home of H. D. Woodson from 1909 to 1913.

This collection consists of materials found in the former home of Mr. Howard D. Woodson. They consist of personal materials from his time in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and materials from his time as superintendent of Sunday school at the Metropolitan A. M. E. Church in Washington, DC. Materials include, a commencement program, a tax levy, class lists, treasurer reports, monthly reports, annual reports, teaching aides, construction quotes and contracts, invoices, and speeches. The materials are arranged in alphabetical order by title or subject.
